alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 7:03PM MST until August 16 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MST/1015 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR NAVAJO COUNTY NEAR POLACCA... At 700 PM MST /800 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Heavy rain has also fallen near Second Mesa and Hotevilla, with flooding possible in those areas as well. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Polacca Airport, Village of Walpi, First Mesa, Polacca, Hopi Reservation and the Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 387 and 400. State Route 87 between mile markers 387 and 390...and between mile markers 398 and 401. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Coyote Wash, Polacca Wash, Jeddito Wash and Keams Canyon Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
